review: I've been using my Chromecast nearly daily since it arrived and it's worked flawlessly!Some hotels are starting to get wise on these things and either physically locking their HDMI inputs or using bluecoat type devices to block them on their networks.  Marriott and La Quinta hotels work well; Hilton seems to get throttled down a lot though.  Can't speak for other hotel chains because those are the ones I stay in mostly since I have long standing Rewards memberships with them.Biggest downfall is there is NO Amazon Video capabilities native with it.  I'm guessing Amazon wants you to buy their Fire Stick instead for that.  There are "work-arounds" for that though but video quality lacks.  It's pretty much surfing through internet sessions and sharing your devices screen with Chromecast to make it work.For those of you who like XDA or toying with your Android devices; you can toy with this too.  Check your normal websites like XDA and whatnot :)

review: Works very well, you can control it from your phone and pretty much project anything you have on your phone without wires, this does not come with a remote but your phone is the remote. It connects straight to hdmi port in your tv, the media player also need to be plugged into usb port to get power that was about the only thing I didnt like, everything else works as expected and the quality of the picture is awesome
